result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica A Bristow

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Jessica A Bristow in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Jessica A Bristow.  Prosecuting attorney Molly Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense has received discovery but have not yet received an offer. 
State will route to assigned ADA for an offer.
Attorney Carlson requests an additional further proceedings date.  
Court adjourns for 30 days for additional further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Brandon Carlson as counsel of record for the defendant.

10:27 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jessica A Bristow in court.  Court reviews the case on the record and notes at the last hearing the defendant advised she had retained Atty. Bordow.  Defendant advises she has not heard back from Atty. Bordow and have not been able to formally retain him at this time.  Defendant advises she does want counsel in this matter and plans to report to the Public Defender's office to be evaluated for representation.  Court notes this matter has been pending for some time now, it will pass the case to allow the defendant time to call the Public Defender's office to be evaluated today.  Court takes a break at 10:29 a.m. to allow the defendant time to call the Public Defender's office.  Case recalled at 11:08 a.m.; all appearances remain the same.  Defendant advises she qualified for a Public Defender and an attorney will be appointed.  State is just asking the matter be set over for further proceedings/status of counsel in a couple weeks.  Court adjourns for status of counsel in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:06 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Jessica A Bristow in court. Court reviews the case on the record and inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises she has retained Atty. David Bordow, but due to some health issues was not able to appear today.  Court will adjourn for continued status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:26 PM Defendant Jessica A Bristow in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel and states she intends to retain Attorney Bourdo.  Victim A appeared in Court and presents a statement.  Court notes there is a discrepency that $1,200.00 was ordered forfeited at the prior non appearance but there was actually only $600.00 posted and that may be refunded to the poster.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:44 AM Defendant Jessica A Bristow not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a $1,500.00 arrest warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 3.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Laura F. Lau on 7/5/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
